text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I'm going to show

you how to make what I call a creamy Parmesan
and tomato skillet chicken, it's so good and

it's so easy and you can serve this with noodles,
you can serve it with rice, you can serve

it with pasta you can serve it with tortellini,
you can serve it with anything you want.

But the recipe for the chicken itself is just
dynamite and it's so easy!

Let me run you through the list of most of
the ingredients.
You'll need really lovely thick chicken breast.

You'll also need peppers onions and garlic,
a little Italian seasoning, salt and olive

oil and what I have here is homemade marinara
sauce which you can make and keep on hand

in the fridge or freezer or you can use store
bought, and some chicken stock to thin it
out.

I have some olive oil in my skillet pre-heating
over about medium heat.

And you're going to need a few more ingredients
toward the end but we're not there yet so
let's not even think about it.
Let's go!

First thing first, I'm going to just season
the one side of my chicken with some salt.
And some Italian seasoning.

This, to me, has the flavor of chicken parm
and chicken alfredo mixed.

Like that creamy delicious saucy parmesan-y
yumminess all combined into one and it's so

fast, within a half an hour, you've got dinner
on the table that I'm telling you everyone
is going to love!

The skillet is hot, I'm going to add my chicken
in, season side down.

That way, once it's in I can season the opposite
side and I'm going to let these cook for a
few minutes on each side.

They won't be cooked all the way through but
that's okay.

Then I'm going to return them to the pan once
we get our sauce in so I'm just going to season

this side, let them cook for a few minutes
on each side and when they're a really beautiful

color, I"m going to take them out and then
I will add the veggies in and let those cook
until they sweat.

Chicken looks gorgeous, I'm going to just
put the veggies in now.

Give that a good scrape and I'm going to add
a touch more oil.
The pan is a little dry.

Touch more oil, a little bit of salt to the
veggies.

I'm going to cook these over medium heat because
I don't want to burn the garlic just for a

few minutes I want the veggies to start to
soften and develop a little bit of color and
then I'll show you the next step.

These look amazing, so now what I'm going
to do is I'm going to put the chicken back

in, kind of nestle them around and over the
veggies, right?
Look how beautiful that is already.
Oh I just love it!
Just love it.

Okay, take this little juice here, it's good
stuff.
And then your stock and sauce mixture.
You pour that over the top.
Shake it around.

I'm going to add the leftover Italian seasoning
I already had out anyway.

So now what I'm going to do is I'm going to
take a lid and I'm going to partially cover

this because I want the chicken to cook thoroughly,
all the way in.
All the way throughout.

So I'm just going to cover this and let this
simmer for about ten minutes.

After ten minutes I'm going to take the chicken
out and meet you back here to finish the sauce.

Alright, now I took my chicken out, it was
simmering for about ten minutes.
Look at this!
Look at the beautiful-ness of it!

Now, to my sauce, I am going to add a little
cream cheese and now I know I sound crazy

but you're going to have to just trust me
on this.
And a good amount of freshly grated parm.

And what I'm going to do is I'm just going
to patiently sit here and I want this on low,

because I just want to cook this long enough
to melt the cream cheese and this gives you

the most luxurious lovely creamy tomato sauce
without having to add any heavy cream to it
because heavy cream is, you know, quite liquidy.

So you have to have a thickener like a flour
rue or something to this - but by adding the
cream cheese, look it's perfect.
You don't have to do any of that.

So I'm just going to babysit this until all
the cream cheese is melted and then you dig
in!
Just going to turn this off.
And it is done!

Now I am boiling some egg noodles in the back
to serve this with, but you can serve this
with whatever your heart desires.

But I mean it's like luscious and thick and
so beautiful.

Like, I can't even tell you how excited this
makes me.

Now when I do bring this to the table, because
I really am going to bring this to the table

for dinner, I'm going to sprinkle a little
bit of parm over the top, a little extra parm,
some fresh basil.
Done.

It's that simple but it is so - you're going
to love it!

I'm just going to go in for this piece right
here.
One little bite.
I'm just going to do that because I can.

That's the plus of being your own boss in
the kitchen!
Ha!
Oh my word!
It is 'Smack Somebody!'
kind of good!
I'm going to go back in for more.

I can't help myself, I'm telling you, it's
such a winner...
Winner winner chicken dinner!
Get it?

It's such a winner, everyone is going to absolutely
go crazy for it and you're going to probably

have some extra sauce left over if you're
not going to use a noodle or like a rice or

anything to soak it up but store it in a container
and then use it over top of pasta or anything
it's so good!

LauraintheKitchen.com has the recipe written
for you.

I hope you have enjoyed spending time with
me.

Please make this right now, it's unbelievably
good and I will see you next time!
Bye!
